<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 194, 220, 208]]<|/det|>
# MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 216, 356, 232]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3 (P3)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 259, 455, 303]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Answer Booklet/Paper Graph Paper List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 320, 390, 337]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 351, 828, 367]]<|/det|>
If you have been given an Answer Booklet, follow the instructions on the front cover of the Booklet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 368, 722, 384]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 384, 327, 400]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 400, 497, 416]]<|/det|>
You may use a soft pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 416, 601, 432]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 447, 284, 462]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 463, 907, 494]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 494, 588, 510]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 510, 606, 526]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 540, 606, 556]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 556, 756, 572]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 572, 440, 588]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[94, 588, 907, 619]]<|/det|>
Questions carrying smaller numbers of marks are printed earlier in the paper, and questions carrying larger numbers of marks later in the paper.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 615, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the quotient and remainder when \(2x^{2}\) is divided by \(x + 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 125, 97, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 119, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
Expand \(\frac{1 + 3x}{\sqrt{(1 + 2x)}}\) in ascending powers of \(x\) up to and including the term in \(x^{2}\), simplifying the coefficients.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 149, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 201, 96, 220]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 193, 920, 234]]<|/det|>
Express \(\frac{7x^{2} - 3x + 2}{x(x^{2} + 1)}\) in partial fractions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 205, 920, 223]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 257, 96, 276]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[124, 257, 450, 278]]<|/det|>
(i) Solve the equation \(|4x - 1| = |x - 3|\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 259, 920, 278]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 289, 767, 310]]<|/det|>
(ii) Hence solve the equation \(\left|4^{y + 1} - 1\right| = \left|4^{y} - 3\right|\) correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 291, 920, 310]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 336, 96, 355]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 335, 897, 355]]<|/det|>
For each of the following curves, find the gradient at the point where the curve crosses the \(y\)-axis:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 368, 156, 389]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 368, 260, 400]]<|/det|>
\(y = \frac{1 + x^{2}}{1 + \mathrm{e}^{2x}}\) ;

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 377, 920, 395]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 415, 151, 433]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 415, 311, 433]]<|/det|>
\(2x^{3} + 5xy + y^{3} = 8.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 416, 920, 435]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 460, 96, 480]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 460, 720, 481]]<|/det|>
The points \(P\) and \(Q\) have position vectors, relative to the origin \(O\), given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[319, 488, 678, 510]]<|/det|>
\[\overrightarrow{OP} = 7\mathbf{i} + 7\mathbf{j} - 5\mathbf{k}\quad \mathrm{and}\quad \overrightarrow{OQ} = -5\mathbf{i} + \mathbf{j} + \mathbf{k}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 516, 920, 537]]<|/det|>
The mid-point of \(PQ\) is the point \(A\). The plane \(\varPi\) is perpendicular to the line \(PQ\) and passes through \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 548, 151, 567]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 548, 740, 567]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of \(\varPi\), giving your answer in the form \(ax + by + cz = d\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 549, 920, 567]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 579, 151, 597]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 579, 920, 613]]<|/det|>
The straight line through \(P\) parallel to the \(x\)-axis meets \(\varPi\) at the point \(B\). Find the distance \(AB\), correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 596, 920, 615]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 640, 101, 660]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 640, 146, 660]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 640, 526, 660]]<|/det|>
Without using a calculator, solve the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 666, 583, 685]]<|/det|>
\[3w + 2iw^{*} = 17 + 8\mathrm{i},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 691, 828, 711]]<|/det|>
where \(w^{*}\) denotes the complex conjugate of \(w\). Give your answer in the form \(a + bi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 692, 920, 711]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 724, 146, 742]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 724, 406, 742]]<|/det|>
In an Argand diagram, the loci

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[336, 747, 662, 769]]<|/det|>
\[\arg (z - 2\mathrm{i}) = \frac{1}{6}\pi \quad \mathrm{and} \quad |z - 3| = |z - 3\mathrm{i}|\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 777, 920, 812]]<|/det|>
intersect at the point \(P\). Express the complex number represented by \(P\) in the form \(r\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta}\), giving the exact value of \(\theta\) and the value of \(r\) correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 797, 920, 814]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 848, 96, 867]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 841, 146, 866]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 839, 462, 871]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\int_{2}^{4}4x\ln x \mathrm{d}x = 56\ln 2 - 12.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 848, 920, 867]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 897, 146, 916]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 890, 728, 925]]<|/det|>
Use the substitution \(u = \sin 4x\) to find the exact value of \(\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{24}\pi}\cos^{3}4x \mathrm{d}x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 899, 920, 918]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
(i) Express \(4 \cos \theta + 3 \sin \theta\) in the form \(R \cos (\theta - \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0 < \alpha < \frac{1}{2}\pi\). Give the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 88, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 120, 160, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 120, 215, 138]]<|/det|>
Hence

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 144, 185, 163]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[201, 144, 628, 163]]<|/det|>
solve the equation \(4 \cos \theta + 3 \sin \theta = 2\) for \(0 < \theta < 2\pi\),

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 145, 920, 163]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 170, 188, 195]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 170, 437, 210]]<|/det|>
find \(\int \frac{50}{(4 \cos \theta + 3 \sin \theta)^2} \mathrm{d}\theta .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 180, 920, 199]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 240, 102, 257]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 237, 920, 305]]<|/det|>
Liquid is flowing into a small tank which has a leak. Initially the tank is empty and, \(t\) minutes later, the volume of liquid in the tank is \(V \mathrm{cm}^3\). The liquid is flowing into the tank at a constant rate of \(80 \mathrm{cm}^3\) per minute. Because of the leak, liquid is being lost from the tank at a rate which, at any instant, is equal to \(kV \mathrm{cm}^3\) per minute where \(k\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 317, 156, 335]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 316, 828, 336]]<|/det|>
Write down a differential equation describing this situation and solve it to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 343, 581, 373]]<|/det|>
\[V = \frac{1}{k} (80 - 80\mathrm{e}^{-kt}).\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 350, 920, 369]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 393, 153, 411]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 392, 722, 411]]<|/det|>
It is observed that \(V = 500\) when \(t = 15\), so that \(k\) satisfies the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 420, 561, 450]]<|/det|>
\[k = \frac{4 - 4\mathrm{e}^{-15k}}{25}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 459, 920, 508]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula, based on this equation, to find the value of \(k\) correct to 2 significant figures. Use an initial value of \(k = 0.1\) and show the result of each iteration to 4 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 495, 920, 512]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 522, 151, 541]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 521, 920, 555]]<|/det|>
Determine how much liquid there is in the tank 20 minutes after the liquid started flowing, and state what happens to the volume of liquid in the tank after a long time.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 537, 920, 555]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 75, 564, 90]]<|/det|>
# BLANK PAGE
